pr_title: Fixing Vendor Extensions visible issue in swagger editor

timeline.message: Fixing Vendor Extensions visible issue in swagger editor

timeline.bodyText: isn't these key names are already defined somewhere?
timeline.author: ruks

replies.bodyText: No. These keys are not defined in anywhere
replies.author: HiranyaKavishani

replies.bodyText: Isn't these are added by APIM?
replies.author: ruks

replies.bodyText: Do we even add x-wso2-disable-security in API Manager? If not, why do we even try to remove it?
replies.author: AmaliMatharaarachchi

replies.bodyText: Got it. You are trying to remove all mgw supported extensions in APIM I believe, no matter APIM supports them or not. Please add this to the PR description and add comments in the code to avoid confusion.
replies.author: AmaliMatharaarachchi

replies.bodyText:
No. When someone importing a microgateway compatible swagger file with vendor extensions, this issue is reproducible. Better we remove them if they exist. @praminda is it?
The issue has been reported at wso2/product-apim#5162
replies.author: HiranyaKavishani

replies.bodyText:
@AmaliMatharaarachchi yes Correct. +1.
Changed the PR description. Do we need to add these comments to the code again as we already mentioned at the method description [1]? I think no right?
[1] 
  
    
      carbon-apimgt/components/apimgt/org.wso2.carbon.apimgt.impl/src/main/java/org/wso2/carbon/apimgt/impl/definitions/OASParserUtil.java
    
    
         Line 1112
      in
      eae2fc4
    
    
    
    

        
          
                * remove publisher/MG related extension from OAS
replies.author: HiranyaKavishani

replies.bodyText: Is there a use case to import MG generated swagger to APIM? I think APIM doesn't have to manage extension not added by APIM.
replies.author: ruks
